Rarity and AppleJack quickly ran out the library back towards their homes. Fluttershy followed them as well but Pinkie couldn't help but feel sad as she see Twilight is getting up. "Hey Twilight" RD said "No hard feelings right." she was nervous.


"NO I DON'T WANT YOU OR PINKIE IN MY HOUSE EVER AGAIN! Twilight horn was glowing cyan,Pink,White,butterscotch,orange and lavender as Rainbow Dash and Pinkie Pie are outside Twilight's house as they see a large Rainbow bubble shield around her home.
1521212.title: They're decide to leave; Twilight kicks Rai...

choices: Rainbow Dash continues to fart up a storm in the library
She leaves (she's either out of gas for now or chooses a new victim)
Twilight casts a spell to punish Rainbow Dash
1522.content:
Rainbow Dash landed next to the Ponyville library. She was looking forward to this! She knocked on the door which was promptly opened by a small purple dragon. "Oh, hey, Rainbow Dash, what's up?" Spike answered.

Rainbow Dash glanced past Spike to see whether or not Twilight was within hearing distance of their conversation. From the doorway, Rainbow Dash could see Twilight sitting at her favorite desk. It didn't look like she was within listening distance and she seemed too wrapped up in the book she was reading to pay attention to what was being said, but Rainbow Dash kept her voice down just to be safe. "Spike, you know that... 'present' I gave you for your birthday?" Rainbow Dash smiled.

"The dumbbell?" Spike asked.

"No, no, the other one. The one I gave you when Twilight wasn't around." Rainbow whispered. "You know, the one where you pulled my hoof."

"Oh, right! That was awesome, Rainbow, I still laugh my tail off thinking about it," Spike chuckled.

"Me too," Rainbow Dash concurred with a grin.

"I still can't believe anypony could have that much gas!" Spike recalled.

"Well you better believe it. Because I've come to do the same thing to Twilight and this one is gonna be even better!" Rainbow Dash boasted.

"No way!" Spike gasped in disbelief.

"Spike! Wasn't there someone at the door a minute ago?" Twilight Sparkle called.

"Yeah, she's still here! It's Rainbow Dash!" Spike shouted back.

"Oh, I can't wait to see the look on Twilight Sparkle's face!" Spike quietly mused as he followed Rainbow Dash.

"Ssh," Rainbow Dash shushed him. Even though she agreed, she didn't want to ruin the surprise.

"Hi, Rainbow Dash," Twilight warmly greeted when she entered speakingdistance. Twilight used her magic to get a bookmark to mark her place and shut her book as she turned around. "What brings you here?"

"Oh, everyone else was busy and I was in the neighborhood so I figured I'd drop in," she answered.

"You mean I'm not busy?" Twilight asked, shooting a glance to the mountain of books on her desk.

"Oh, right, sorry." Rainbow stammered.

"It's alright," Twilight assured. "Is there anything you want to discuss?"

Rainbow Dash's stomach began gurgling yet again as if to remind her why she was there. Twilight didn't seem to hear it, however. Rainbow made a contemplative expression as if she didn't have any specific reason for coming over. "Well there is one thing..." she began. She extended her front right hoof. "Pull my hoof," she asked. Spike, who had been standing behind her during this conversation, moved in front of her and stood next to Twilight as soon as he heard Rainbow Dash ask this.

Twilight Sparkle hesitated. "What on earth is that supposed to accomplish?" she pondered aloud.

"Just pull it," Rainbow impatiently urged.

Twilight reached out with her front hooves to pull it. Right before her hooves made contact with Rainbow's, she quickly withdrew them and asked, "Is this some sort of trick?"

"Even if it were, why would I tell you?" Rainbow Dash dryly interjected. "Anyway, I asked Spike to do this and he liked the, um, 'end result' I guess to speak Twilightese."

"Spike, is this true?" Twilight asked, giving her assistant a puzzled look.

"Yeah, Twilight, you'll love it!" Spike assured.

Twilight Sparkle finally gave Rainbow Dash's hoof a gentle pull. This was immediately accompanied by bombastic flatulence. Rainbow Dash's fart was so noisy it shook the walls with such force that books fell from shelves. When the incredibly long fart finally came to an end, Rainbow Dash and Spike gave each other a high five (or, rather, a high hoof and high claw) and laughed at the unbelievable amount of gas Rainbow had. Twilight, on the other hand, had a much less favorable reaction. In addition to the sheer force of the fart causing her library to become disorganized, the air in the library was thick with the stench of Rainbow Dash's fart.

Rainbow Dash plotted her next move. On one hand, she thought staying would be fun. At least Spike seemed to be enjoying himself almost as much as she was and the shocked expression on Twilight's face throughout the duration of her fart was priceless! On the other hand, she knew this probably already put her on thin ice with Twilight and part of her didn't want to ruin their friendship completely just because of her love for fart jokes.
1522.title: Breaking the silence in the library

choices: Twilight finally gives into peer pressure and farts.
Twilight still finds it embarrassing and immature and refuses to fart.
15221.content:
"She'll get over it," Rainbow Dash reasoned to herself, "we've been friends for too long for her to stay mad over a few farts."

"Very mature," Twilight Sparkle sarcastically quipped.

"Oh, lighten up," Rainbow said, still beaming at the hilariously loud sound that had recently come out of her behind. "You know you've never heard anypony fart like that before!" she boasted.

"Am I supposed to be impressed?" Twilight dully asked.

"Yeah! Why wouldn't you be?" Rainbow asked.

Twilight Sparkle rolled her eyes and sighed. "Here I am reading books ponies who actually contributed to society - inventors, explorers, spell and potion creators - and you expect me to be impressed by flatulence?"

"That gives me a great idea! They should write a book about my farts!" Rainbow joked.

"That's not what I-" Twilight Sparkle attempted to explain. But Rainbow Dash paid her no mind.

"Hey, Spike, I think it's time we get back to writing that autobiography," Rainbow winked. "Only this time, let's try it from a new angle: the back angle!"

"Good idea!" Spike said, playing along, taking a scroll and quill.

"I thought I told you an autobiography is written by-" Twilight attempted correcting them. But she was interrupted yet again. Only this time, it was the other end of Rainbow Dash that cut her off. The sound and smell of her fart quickly filled the library. Twilight was coughing and gagging a little, but Spike didn't seem to mind. Like Rainbow Dash, he found it more funny than gross.

"That must be a fart cloud on my cutie mark!" Rainbow Dash bragged.

"I'll say!" Spike agreed. Rainbow Dash and Spike amused themselves with more of Rainbow's farts which were almost always accompanied with a joke of some kind by one of the two and were always followed by a guffaw from both. Twilight returned to her reading, apparently attempting to ignore them, but having visible annoyed reactions every time Rainbow farted. Rainbow's farts were so frequent that they interrupted Twilight Sparkle's concentration so much she almost never turned a page.

Twilight shot the two a frustrated glare after one of Rainbow Dash's particularly long farts. Rainbow just moaned ecstatically (that fart was the most relieving thing she ever experienced), smirked and said, "Oh, come on, Twilight, don't act like you don't look forward to your own big farts. They always feel so good and you know it! Twilight just blushed and went back to reading.

After what seemed like the twentieth fart from Rainbow Dash since she entered the library (although no one was counting), she made another comment about Twilight farting. "I'll bet you've been building up a good one over there since I've come in here." Twilight pretended not to hear her and turned the page in her book. "Hey, Spike, you're around her almost 24/7," Rainbow Dash continued. "What are her farts like?"

"Well, usually, they're --" Spike began.

"Spike! Don't answer that!" Twilight blushed.

"Why not? I can fart without shame, why can't you?" Rainbow Dash asked. She ripped a short, but very loud fart to emphasize her point.

"What's this sudden obsession with my farts?" Twilight asked, face still red with embarrassment.

"Just trying to give you a chance to prove you're not a total egghead and that you like something awesome for a change," Rainbow Dash shrugged. "I mean, there's no reason for you to hold it in when it's just me and Spike since we obviously don't judge over that stuff."
15221.title: Rainbow Dash: The Autobiography (written by Spike)

choices: Rainbow turning around to fart in her face
152211.content:
Twilight sighed and walked toward Rainbow Dash. "If it will satisfy your curiosity and let me get back to reading," she grumbled. A quiet, yet audible fart made its way out of her rump. Its lack of volume was compensated by a tremendous length. Naturally, Rainbow Dash and Spike laughed after several seconds of this, their laughter growing more uproarious with the fart's length. Twilight moaned in immense relief.

"Haha, feels awesome, doesn't it?" Rainbow giggled. Twilight didn't answer. She merely blushed and quickly adopted a facial expression that seemed as if she was wondering why she even did what she just did. "I gotta say, Twilight, I'm impressed. That wasn't quite as long as my or Pinkie's best ones," she bragged, "but for someone who hasn't trained like we have, you've got potential."

"...Trained?" Twilight panted in disbelief.

"Well yeah," Rainbow Dash answered in a tone as if Twilight had just asked if the sky was blue. "We gotta train if we wanna be the best. You can train with us if you ever wanna learn how to fart like, say, I don't know," she said, her voice starting to wander before punctuating the sentence with a proud "this!" The room started to shake from the deep, heavy rumble. Rrainbow proudly grinned as Spike burst into guffaw. Spike's laughter grew wilder when Rainbow Dash smirked and began pushing harder, making the floor shake even more violently. Eventually, Rainbow Dash started pushing softer and softer. It sounded as if the fart was dying down, but after several seconds of near-silence, she pushed her hardest yet. After this final push, her fart reached an abrupt halt.

"Way to go, Rainbow Dash, that was amazing!" Spike cheered.

Rainbow Dash did not react to this. She felt so much satisfaction that again, all she could do was sigh. "Aaaaaaaahhhhh, yes!" she moaned. "Oh my gosh, that felt sooo good!" she sighed. Once she caught her breath, she giggled. As her laughter started to die down, she broadly grinned. It was everything she could hope for in a fart: that breathtaking feeling of relief and an extremely comical sound. "C'mon, Twilight, don't you wanna learn to fart like that?" Rainbow proudly asked.

Twilight rolled her eyes, unimpressed. "Actually, I -- " Twilight began. But she was interrupted.

What interrupts her?

With mine and Pinkie's training. You could fart just as awesome as us! Come on, what do you say?" Dash stuck her hoof out, waiting for Twilight to hoof bump her in a deal.

Dash was persistent. Almost seeming as if she would never let Twilight really make an honest choice on her own.

1553321212.content:
Chrysalis toyed with the notion of being tactful about her revenge as she landed atop the roof of a nearby house. Although it would be wise to make sure the locals were not made aware of her presence in broad daylight, one look at Twilight Sparkle's face, nestled within a book as she entered her home, melted away all sense of logic in her mind and replaced it with a burning hatred.

That blasted brat and her little friends didn't hesitate to make me look like a fool back in Canterlot, thought the Queen. I'm simply returning the favor.

Her taut and bloated belly gave another resounding growl in approval of her decision.

With a sinister smirk, Chrysalis extended her wings and gracefully glided downward until she touched down directly in front of Twilight's door. It glowed a dark green as Chrysalis swung in open with reckless abandon.

Twilight, who had been attending to her books before Chrysalis's grand entrance yelped in surprise and looked back to see where the noise had come from. The moment she laid her gaze upon the obsidian alicorn, her pupils dilated in pure shock.

"Ch-Chrysalis?" Twilight stuttered Twilight.

"In the flesh," she said, her words dripping with malicious poison. The Queen took a step forward, which seemed to rouse Twilight from her stupor. The two activated their horns almost simultaneously, both sending out blasts of magic heading directly towards each other. Chrysalis effortlessly dodged the blast meant for her while Twilight was knocked back into her bookshelf, causing multiple novels to topple down and litter the floor around her.

Chrysalis gave another devilish grin, and cockily sauntered over to her fallen prey, the plump pillows of flesh on her backside jiggling and jostling to match her stride.

She lowered her head until she came face to face with the purple mare. "Twilight Sparkle," she breathed, "the ringleader of the group of ponies who humiliated me, brought down by a single blast. How pathetic."

Twilight feebly whimpered, "But we defeated you..."

Chrysalis chuckled and turned around, presenting Twilight with her massive rump. "One thing you'd ought to know about Changelings, my dear, is that we're quite the persistent bunch..." Ever so slowly, she lowered her butt until it made contact with Twilight's face. "...and I'm the Queen of them all."

Now that Chrysalis has Twilight right where she wants her, how should she go about letting the gas fly?

Peace. Tranquility.

Luna was surrounded by the beauty of nature. Lush evergreen pine trees, soft winds blowing, the moon, Her moon, hanging giant in the sky amongst the tapestry of stars and constellations and brilliant galaxies, all reflecting off of the water, brilliant blue butterflies dancing around and the occasional crow soaring by... it was a beautiful sight.

The princess of the night was proud of the beauty she had bestowed upon the world. She gazed upon the sight. Upon nature. Upon her beautiful, natural kingdom of night.

And in addition to all that... she was alone. Finally. Miles and miles form anypony else. Meaning she was finally free to let loose with her gas.

The mountains were her own little private sanctuary.

Her stomach rumbled and she didn’t hesitate. She lifted up a leg and a massive, deep, wet poot sounded off, echoing through the mountain range.

Nopony heard.

Finally completely relaxed, Luna sighed a sigh of relief and smiled. No more worries. Only relief and freedom.

She farted loudly yet again, and again. She didn’t hold back. Her crescent-marked rump could be as loud as it wanted.

POOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOT!

BRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRP!

FLOOOOOOOOOOOORRRRRRRRRRRT!

Even though the sounds would be considered disgusting by most residents of Canterlot, Luna didn’t care. She didn’t have to worry about being uncouth anymore.

FRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRT!

She took a few steps forward and dipped into a nearby lake. Bubbles erupted from her plot. She swam around. She farted some more. More bubbles.

This was great.

She felt truly at one with nature.

As the night went on, Luna continued to frolick and fart her flank off, all to her heart’s content. All the worries in her normal life melted away.

Eventually, however, Luna’s stomach finally started to calm down. Right, in fact, as it was time for Luna to head back to Canterlot and lower the moon so her sister could take over.

As she started to fly off, she let out one last poot, and flew back.

Upon her return to Canterlot, she met up with Celestia right before the trade-off was set to occur.

“Say, sister, I rather loved the dish you made for me last night. I wouldn’t mind... having it more often.”

Celestial smiled. “Of course, Luna.”

Luna smiled right back. That night farting and frolicking in the mountains would not be her last.

GOOD END

Fortunately for her, Luna was too busy shouting orders at her teammates to hear it.

Luna, still focused on her game, simply said, "Not now, Celestia." After a brief moment, this sentence processed in her head, she said, "Wait, Celestia!?" Finally, the moment Celestia was waiting for: Luna had turned around, facing her rump.

Celestia slyly smiled as she unleashed as much gas as she could. The sheer force of it not only created a rumbling sensation in the room, but it blew Luna's headset off and blew her mane back. Luna soon coughed on the stench, gagging too much to focus on casting a teleportation spell on Celestia or herself, trapping Celestia in a magical forcefield that would trap her in with the smell, or any other spell that would be useful in the situation. She could only endure as Celestia bombarded her with more and more loud and long blasts of flatulence.

Celestia took a break from her farting to turn around. She giggled a little as she did so. "Oh, Luna, I'm not sure whether I should be mad at you or thank you. After all, your prank was actually a bit fun once it backfired, if you'll pardon the pun." A brief, but very loud fart emphasized this joke, prompting Celestia to giggle a bit more before concluding, "Yes, fart jokes are loads of fun in the proper time and place, but royal events where your reputation is on the line are hardly the time or the place!"

Around the time Celestia was finished speaking, Luna had finally stopped coughing enough to speak. Celestia wasn't ready for what she was about to say.
155332222111121.title: Its Time to Fart

1553322221111211.content:
"Celestia... what are you talking about?"

Celestia's eyes widened in surprise for a moment, then a look of confusion quickly swept over her face. However, as quickly as this expression arrived, it left. "Don't play dumb with me, Luna." Celestia took a couple more steps toward her. "You and I both know that cake was specifically made to give me lots of gas!"

"It was not," Luna firmly insisted.

Celestia stared into her eyes for a few seconds that seemed to pass slowly. She knew her sister's tells. She was just waiting her to blink more than usual, to touch her hoof to her face, or another thing she does that would indicate she's lying. But Celestia just couldn't discern anything out of the ordinary. She was telling the truth. "Oh my... sorry, Luna." Celestia blushed. "It's just... I could have sworn you were the one that played this prank, so I figured it'd only be fair to fight fire with fire. Or, in this case, fight fart jokes with fart jokes."

"Heh, don't worry about it. I know if somepony tried to gas me up like that and I thought I knew who did it, I probably would have done the same thing."

"Glad to hear there are no hard feelings. But if you're telling the truth - which I think you are - there are a couple weird things that don't add up."

"Like what?"

"I overheard some batpony guards mention something about you being sick and that's why you weren't downstairs."

"That's strange," Luna said. "There was a pony napping somewhere who needed my help and advice. So I was appearing to him in his dreams; that's what I was busy with," she explained. "I wasn't playing games the whole time if that's what you were thinking," she said, "I honestly just started. I figured by the time I got downstairs, you guys would just be wrapping up so there wasn't much of a point of showing up right at the end. Perhaps the pony who said I was sick was in on it," Luna speculated.

"I see," Celestia said, still examining Luna's body language to detect a lie but not noticing anything that would indicate one. "Still, you personally gave me that piece of cake, yourself and it was the only thing out of the ordinary I've eaten today."

"I did set it down in the kitchen for a couple of minutes," Luna recalled. "Somepony probably tampered with it then."

"Very well," Celestia said. Her stomach rumbled a little. "I still have a bit of gas left over, but I should be able to hold it till the party; it's about over anyway. Will you help me find the prankster?"

"Of course," Luna said. "In fact, perhaps I'll have a little snack beforehand to show whoever's responsible why you don't put the blame on a princess."

Celestia smiled. "Great! I'll come get you in a little bit." Celestia started to leave, but right when she got to the door, she turned around and said, "By the way, you should probably go ahead and get started on that snack. Something tells me it won't take us long to find our culprit."

"Will do," Luna said.

On Celestia's way downstairs, she noticed the batponies by Luna's room were now nowhere to be found; they were obviously in on it. But they probably weren't responsible for the prank itself, she reasoned. After all, they had been posted there all day; none of them could have done it. Celestia kept her eyes open for anypony suspicious when she made it back to the party.

"I'm sorry to say we have to end things a little early," Celestia called out. A few ponies in the crowd loudly grumbled. Celestia, however, was unwavering. She stood up straighter and lifted one of her front hooves, assuming an authoritative pose. "I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience, but there is an urgent royal matter that I must attend to." A couple of the complainers seemed reluctant to leave. Celestia was tempted to let loose one of the obnoxiously powerful farts she was currently capable of, thanks to the anonymous prankster, to urge them out quickly. But, fortunately, they listened to their princess and left on their own accord.

While watching the ponies leave, Celestia made a note to look for anypony suspicious. Perhaps this was some tactic by one of Canterlot's enemies to ruin her reputation. But Celestia soon abandoned this theory when she couldn't spot any strangers. Remembering Luna mentioning whoever did it had to have gone into the kitchen at some point, she knew this meant one of two things: it was either somepony on her kitchen staff or somepony who didn't belong there who somehow managed to get in.

Once the guests all left, Celestia stepped into the kitchen. There, the head chef, Cinnamon Swirl, was managing the closing ritual of making sure everything was clean, food was stored properly, etc. "Cinnamon Swirl," Celestia said. He was so busy it took him a moment to realize whose voice it was who said his name.

"Yes, Princess?" he asked.

"I just have a couple questions. First, did you see anypony who wasn't on staff enter the kitchen at all today?"

"There was a pink earth pony," he said. "She seemed to be trying to taste the desserts. But we quickly got her out."

"Balloons on her cutie mark, I'd imagine?"

"Yes, how did you know?"

"I had a hunch," Celestia said. "Anything else out of the ordinary happen today?"

"Not really. Aside from us being understaffed thanks to Pumpkin Spice leaving early."

"Oh? And when did she leave?"

"Not long before that pink pony showed up, now that I think about it," he said. "Sometime around noon, maybe twelve thirty."

Celestia remembered this was pretty close to the time she ate her cake. "I see."

"Anything else, Princess?"

"No, that's all for now. Thanks," Celestia said. She hurried up the first staircase she could find and navigated the corridors to Luna's room. She smiled when she saw Luna had taken her earlier advice; Luna was just finishing a surprisingly enormous bowl of beans when Celestia came in.

"So, Celestia," Luna said, "Did you find out who did it yet?"

"No, but I've got it narrowed down between a couple people."

"Oh? Who?"

"One is Pinkie Pie," Celestia answered.

"Twilight's friend?" Luna asked, clearly surprised.

Celestia nodded. "She was apparently trying to get her hooves on the sweets. Which definitely sounds like her, if you ask me. Of course, given her history of pulling practical jokes, trying to gas somepony up by messing with the cake definitely sounds like her as well."

"Maybe," Luna said. "But knowing Pinkie and how much she loves cake, don't you think she'd rather eat the cake than use it to prank somepony?"

"A fair question. Anyway, our next suspect is Pumpkin Spice. She works in the kitchen and mysteriously went home shortly after I ate the cake," Celestia said.

"So that's either some poor timing on her part or she had something to do with it," Luna said.

The two sisters investigated a bit further and shared their rationale a bit more before deciding on who to punish for the prank. They ultimately decided on...

155332222222222212121211.content:
"Let's set the mood with some fart stories," Rainbow Dash suggested.

"Sounds fun," Spitfire said with a nod. "I can't think of a good one from the top of my head, so you go first."

Rainbow Dash thought in silence for a couple seconds. "Sorry, I'm having the opposite problem; there are just so many good ones I'm having a bit of trouble deciding!" Her voice was getting fast and enthusiastic. Suddenly, she started suppressing laughter as she remembered an anecdote that was particularly hilarious to her.

"Alright. One of my favorite foods is Cloudsdale Chili. I'm sure you've had it before." Rainbow paused briefly. Spitfire nodded. "When most people cook it, they soak the beans a few hours beforehand because it causes less gas."

"For the record, every time I've had Cloudsdale Chili, it's been with soaked beans and I still got tons of gas," Spitfire said.

Rainbow Dash nodded. "Yeah, but it's because just about all the ingredients cause gas. Onions, garlic, those peppers..." Rainbow trailed off for a second thinking of the other ingredients.

"I've always imagined Cloudsdale Chili was invented as some kind of experiment; whoever came up with that recipe was probably trying to find a way to make earth ponies fly or something."

"Yeah!" Rainbow Dash exclaimed before giggling a bit at Spitfire's joke. "Anyway, back to my story: when I make Cloudsdale Chili, I don't soak my beans, so I'm sure you can imagine how much gassier it gets then. And I tend to add more beans than the recipe calls for. Anyway, a whole pot of that stuff tends to last me a few days. On the third day of that being most of my diet, I kind of forgot my friend Rarity was supposed to be fitting me for a dress she was making me as a gift."

"Oh my gosh," Spitfire said, shaking her head.

"Now, when I remembered I was supposed to meet Rarity, I tried to get it all out of my system. I mean, I know she gets grossed out by that kind of stuff and I wasn't in the mood to get in an argument with her. Plus she was doing something nice for me, so I thought I might as well try my best to make things easiest for her. But you know how Cloudsdale Chili is. After trying to get it all out, I was still full of gas by the time I made it to Rarity's place.

"So there I was, trying to hold it in. It was going fine for the first half hour or so, but then I felt like I was going to explode. And it just so happened that around that time, Rarity decided to start working on the stitching in the flank." Spitfire shook her head once again. "I swear I'm not making this up! But almost as soon as she started working back there, I just couldn't hold it in anymore.

"She thought I did it on purpose. Probably because she didn't think one that loud or long could slip out on accident and I'm sure me laughing my head off didn't help things either. So to prove to her it was an accident, I said, ''That was an accident. This is on purpose,' and showed her what a real Cloudsdale Chili fart sounded like."

Spitfire and Rainbow Dash laughed. "Yeah. Remember how I said she's grossed out by that kind of stuff? You should have heard her!" Rainbow cleared her throat and began speaking in her best Rarity impression, "'Rainbow Dash, how dare you conduct yourself in such a crude manner! Get out of my shop this instant! Why, at this rate, you'll be lucky to get a gift at all!'" She started speaking in her regular voice again, "On the way out the door, I told her the look on her face was enough of a gift to me. I didn't get a good look at her during the first one since she was behind me, but during my second one, she seemed grossed out as usual, but after a while she also started looking kind of scared. Like she was afraid I was never going to stop farting or something."

"After three days of Cloudsdale Chili, she's lucky you did stop farting," Spitfire joked. "I was a little surprised when you said you could fart as loudly as I did earlier, but if you eat like that, then I probably have some catching up to do!"

"Hey, you should have fighting chance when we get down to the pool. I haven't gone too crazy with gassy food today," Rainbow Dash said. Her stomach loudly gurgled. "Then again, I'm still the gassiest pony I know," she bragged, proudly rubbing her belly with one of her front hooves.

"So did Rarity ever finish that dress?" Spitfire asked.

"Yeah," Rainbow said. "She stopped talking to me for a couple days - which was probably for the best for her because I still had some Cloudsdale Chili left over - but she gave me this mushy little talk about how she thought I was immature for finding that kind of stuff funny, but she would be more immature to walk away from a friendship over something like that. But enough of the sappy stuff. Did that remind you of a good fart story?"
155332222222222212121211.title: Rainbow Dash

1553322222222222121212111.content:
"Oh, I've got a good one all right" Spitfire responded in a cocky tone of voice, adding a little chuckle. "Do you know the story of how I got my nickname?"

Rainbow smirked. "No, I haven't. I'd never assumed it had to do with your... little gift."

"Well, sit back, because this one's a doozy. About two years back, the team and I had just finished up a show at the Summer Sun Celebration. It was hot, we were all sweaty, so team showers were in order. I was feeling particularly gassy that day, so I figured I'd let a few out in the showers, no biggie. After all we've all passed gas around eachother in the locker rooms before, haven't we?" Spitfire glaring knowingly at Rainbow, who returned the favor.

"So me and a few others are sharing a shower, I believe it was Fleetfoot and Cloudchaser, and I'm lathering up when I feel one coming on. And it came out big, I mean the entire shower rumbled a little, it was spectacular," Spitfire giggled as she continued to tell the story. "So the others laugh a little and go about showering. It smelled, sure, but it's not like we weren't used to bad smells or anything. So we keep showering and I start to feel even more gas. The more I farted, the others started egging me on, and I started to play around with it. I farted into the water at the bottom of the shower in an attempt to make some bubbles, lathered my ass in liquid soap trying to get the same effect, and even let some go into a sponge. Everything from loud and thunderous to the classic silent but deadlies. It was so much fun."

Rainbow giggled at the various ways Spitfire used and manipulated her flatulence. She thought the two of them should take a shower together some day...

"But as time went on, the smell only got worse and worse, to the point where the others started to ask me to stop."

"Did you?"

"Pfft, of course not! I just kept going, loving it, but unfortunately the smell got so bad that the other two split, and soon enough I found out that I had evacuated the locker room single-handedly."

Rainbow's mouth was agape. "You evacuated an entire locker room with just your farts?"

"Yep. From that day on, I got stuck with the nickname 'Assfire'. I have to admit, I'm a little proud of it. And besides, now the team knows my true strength," Spitfire concluded, with a bit of a joking tone on that last point.

"Man, I don't think even I could top that." Rainbow said.

"Well, it's been about 20 minutes. Shall we head out to the pool?"

She rushed back to where she saw Rainbow Dash and the group of ponies who had gathered around her to listen to her farts. Just as she had hoped, everypony was still there. "I'll bet she's the gassiest pony in all of Equestria!" another murmured. Rainbow Dash seemed to be waiting for the crowd to settle down - she really wanted them to listen to this next one!

15533222222222222222221.content:
Big Macintosh grabbed the final basket of apples and chucked them on the cart behind him, which was already filled with the results of a long days work. Wiping the sweat from his brow, he reached into the front seat, moved aside the (empty) jug of cider, and pulled out the bag of treats Rainbow Dash had delivered earlier that day.

"These are for you." she had explained, "Since Pinky Pie accidentally made twelve dozen plates of snacks, instead of just twelve, she's practically buried in baked goods." "So she's giving some of the extras away to anypony who wants them. " Rainbow had then zipped away before Big Macintosh could respond.

"Guess I may as well try one, since their right here." he muttered, "Let's see, ooh cupcakes, yummy." Choosing one, Big Mac bit into it... and began devouring them all.

"These are so tasty." he thought, nomming down another. "I should 'nom', probably save some for 'munch' AJ, but "omnomnom' these taste so good..." Reaching into the bag, Big Macintosh discovered it was empty. He'd eaten everything in it!

"Ugh, I'm gonna have one upset stomach," he muttered, "And I've still gotta finish my work."

Tossing the empty bag back in the cart, Big Mac began himself back into the harness. No sooner had he finished, than he felt his gut rumble.

FFFAAAARRTT

Big Macintosh felt himself blushing. "Thank Celestia no one heard that." 'sniff' "Or smelled it, phew." "Either way, I gotta move."

Straining his muscles, Big Mac yanked the cart of apples forward, a small *POOOT* of gas slipping out.

"Stupid Cupcakes," he grumbled, "Those are gonna give me major gas, I just know it." "Ugh, hopefully it waits till after I get these apples delivered." Big Macintosh shook his head. "We can't be selling apples that reek of gas."

Big Macintosh frowned. "With a full cart it'll take me an hour to make it back to the farm. " "I hope I can hold it till then..."
15533222222222222222221.title: yes

155332222222222222222211.content:
Big Macintosh hurried towards the farm as fast as possible, the cart of apples bouncing behind him. While he normally refrained from moving at such high speed while carrying any cargo, at the moment he had no choice.

"I've got really, bad gas right now." thought Big Macintosh. His belly rumbled in agreement. "Ugh, gotta hold it in a little longer, just a little longer..."

Reaching the storage barn, Big Macintosh unhooked himself from the cart, and began unloading the apples from it. gurglegroanrumble. "Oh sweet Celestia not now," he said rubbing his stomach, which bubbled loudly, "I'm nearly finished, just gotta wait a little longer."

"There ya are, Big Mac." said a voice from the entrance. "I was worried ya had gotten lost out their or something." "Not a problem A.J.,but I could use a hoof putting these apples away."

"Sure thing bro let me just..." Gwooooorg. "Whoa, what the hay was that?" asked A.J. "Looking at Big Macintosh she asked; "you OK over there?"

"No not really." he muttered. "I've really gotta fart right now..."

"Don't you dare, least not while you're in here." A.J. snapped. "No pony wants to buy fart-scented apples, and you know it."

"No need to get short with me sis." Big Mac responded. "You know that, I know that," he paused to rub his belly "It's my bowels that don't know that." The aforementioned bowels chose that moment to rumble and groan, driving Big Macintosh to his limit. Facing his sister, he said, "Sorry A.J. but I can't hold it in any longer." Big Macintosh then rushed towards the door as fast as he dared, trying to get clear of the barn before he blew. Behind him he heard the barn doors slam shut, A.J. unwilling to risk the apples.

Stopping just outside the barn, Big Macintosh quickly weighed his options. He had to find something or someplace to let rip, but where...?

It came pretty much out of nowhere, right in front of the barn, where the apples were being guarded by his sister. It was the loudest and more powerful fart he has ever released, and it lasted for half a minute. He could have sworn that his sister was yelling at him from behind the door: "Macintosh! Be done fast! The smell is filtering through the door!"

The planks of wood that the door was built with shook with the mere force of the gas, rumbling. He couldn't hear the screams of her sister under such loud outburst of intestinal gas. He closed his eyes and hoped for the best, trying at least not to force much air out.

Finally, the storm that his own body created ceased; but still he could feel more gas inside. He could have probably take the whole barn down if he wanted to. The brownish fog surrounded the wooden building and himself. It was impossible that it didn't filter.
